posts.post_content:
Not bad, although I'd rather have the [Guul Draz Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guul Draz Vampire) and take the evasion. That having been said, combined with his OWN evasion (cough [Vampire Nocturnus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nocturnus) cough) this guy will pile on damage very quickly.
  
   
4/5

Posted By: wolfv (1/29/2010 4:18:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's not [Savannah Lions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savannah Lions), but really powerful for a black card of that sort.  
Compare him to [Maggot Carrier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Maggot Carrier) for instance.  
This guy is going to deal 2 damage once he attacks.  
It might not be able to deal two damage to a single creature, but i'd even consider it to be advantageous to let your opponent lose one life instead since this guy will normally just be blocked by a x/1 creature if you start your first turn with him.  
It's still inferior when used for blocking, but Vampires are found in aggro decks, so we don't have to worry that much about this fact anyways.
posts.html:
It's not Savannah Lions, but really powerful for a black card of that sort.

posts.post_content:
The ability to deal a pretty-much guaranteed 1 damage per turn is nice, but the small frame is definitely a big minus.  
  
The only time tribal aggro has ever had use for 1/1s that want to be turned sideways is when it's something completely broken like [Goblin Lackey](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Lackey).  
  
Nice pick for limited though.

posts.post_content:
This guy is nice, yet I still prefer [Vampire Lacerator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Lacerator) because having two power allows it to trade with a lot more creatures, and having 2 toughness allows it to 'eat' a lot more creatures.  
  
I run these with [Kalastria Highborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kalastria Highborn) to make sure they usually take at least 3 life during most attacks.

posts.post_content:
If you get it in your opening hand against a slow deck, this rocks. I really like this one, having more than one on the board early on can really give you some early quick damage.
  
Don't like lacerator, if the enemy has a wall or disables him, lacerator will kill yourself. This guy is also better later on, since he is sure to give 1 damage when he attack. Don't like the lacerator flavour wise either, that whole cutting yourself thing is too emo.
